inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: 3, 6 (primary), and 12 months, continuously onwards every 1-5 years

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: collected at both baseline and follow-up time points

inclusion.criterion: patient characteristics based on systematic review
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: based on results from our systematic review, used in other studies (when including references)

inclusion.criterion: questionnaires pilot tested among target participants
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Part-Quest among 8-19-year-olds with MSK pain and the Pare-Quest among parents to children with MSK pain

inclusion.criterion: cross-cultural adaptation for participants with poor Danish language skills
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: translated our questionnaires both linguistically and culturally

exclusion.criterion: self-reported musculoskeletal pain due to tumor, fracture, infection, or systemic and neurological causes
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has abdominal pain lasting about 4 days accompanied by nausea and 2 episodes of vomiting. The pain is localized to the epigastric region and radiates to the right upper quadrant. The pain is worsening after eating fatty food.
